subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why do entities lie?
author: Rj
full_text:
--0-709897104-1260402618=:72041
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Primarily the people who care are those selling books about it, making TV=
=C2=A0 specials, putting movies in theaters, and those who have either forg=
otten about all the previous end-of-world predictions that didn't come to p=
ass, or those who need to feel special by having some 'future knowledge', o=
r who have been 'chosen' by the spirits, or something.

Well, anyway, I'm s=
ure they will enjoy themselves,=C2=A0 until about Dec 24, 2012, when they'l=
l have to come up with some new date (and then try to avoid the questions a=
bout how they could have believed it all in the first place).

--- On Wed, =
12/9/09, don powell <dpowell7299@...> wrote:

From: don powell <dpowe=
ll7299@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why do entities lie?
To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com
Date: Wednesday, December 9, 2009, 2:43 PM







=C2=A0



=
  


    
      
      
      
I've always loved this end of the world stuf=
f. =C2=A0The way I see it, if the world ends, I'm dead and I don't care. =
=C2=A0I could just as easily die tomorrow driving to work. =C2=A0So if ther=
e is something you should do while you are alive then do it. =C2=A0Otherwis=
e who cares about worlds ending?
Don
From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@=
 gmail.com>
To:
 EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Wed, December 9, 2009 3:24:=
46 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why do entities lie?

















=C2=A0

=


    
      
      
      =C2=A0I've been doing "box" work for almost ten =
years, and I still get to the decepticons( liars). Perhaps it's just a leve=
l out there, as I think there is an inifinite number of levels and/or demen=
sions. Maybe there is a demonic level? I have a group that communicates, an=
d they usually tell "this is an apple", a metaphor for a truth. Not all of =
these voices are spirit per se`, some have never been human,=C2=A0there is =
a group out there called the fish group, a group of entities that exist off=
 planet and really enjoy screwing with EVPers. =C2=A0I think it was the peo=
ple-I forget their names, experimenting in Luxemberg quite some time ago th=
at first got the Fish Group. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0For me, I don't really care wha=
t comes through, it's the fact that something talks that shouldn't be there=
, my approach hasd always been on the technical side. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0I get s=
ome mediumistic contacts/visions, and I have some spirits that seemingly pr=
efer telepathic contacts, but I don't take=C2=A0that as anymore gosple than=
 anything else. Most of the=C2=A0"communication" tends to be extremely triv=
ial in nature. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0As far as end of the world stuff, I do get th=
at, alot of it, in almost every session, they insist it's true, at least as=
 far as end of the cycle goes, but, and it's a big but, who knows what leve=
l/source that is from--they claim not to be human. Plus we do have access t=
o the future, if I do my meditation regularly I see almost everything ahead=
 of time, plus I dream it, and I know everyone on this planet. I would expe=
ct spirit to be much more aware, at least after they reach a higher state. =
Human is not the highest level, so you can't compare everything to what y'a=
ll think you know. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0Frank-S
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
=C2=A0


=C2=A0
On =
Wed, Dec 9, 2009 at 11:47 AM, michellewisbith <mwisbith@hotmail. com> wrote=
:


=C2=A0 





Hello, all.

My name is Michelle. I'm a certified medium w=
ith a Spiritualist church. This was a two year process which involved provi=
ng I can communicate with spirits to a congregation (not bragging - just tr=
ying to explain my background and why I know what I do). I'm also one of th=
e biggest skeptics you'll ever meet (It was one of two reasons I became a m=
edium. I wanted to see how they were "faking" it. Surprise! They weren't). =
I'd like to contribute what I've learned about spirits. As Jill wrote, "I(t=
) really takes personal experience to believe this stuff exists".


As to h=
er main question of "Why do spirits lie", I don't think we can always assum=
e they're lying. If the information comes through a medium, one of the firs=
t items to address is whether or not the medium received the message correc=
tly and then whether or not he/she interepreted it correctly and phrased it=
 in a way that allowed the recipient to understand the spirit's meaning. Th=
ere are a variety of ways spirits communicate with mediums; some are easier=
 than others to understand and pass on. For the harder methods, it would be=
 possible for a medium to inadvertently misinterept the message based on hi=
s/her past experiences. 


When we look at the question from the connection=
 to EVP's and ghost boxes, we have to examine a few items. Was the spirit a=
ble to use the devices correctly to form the words he/she actually intended=
? This is a two step process. It can be difficult for them to not only pull=
 the available energy into a useable form, but to also form the correct wor=
ds (think it as a foreigner learning English and saying "car" when they mea=
n "star". They sound similar, but have very different meanings). 


Did we =
understand the words they said? It's fairly easy to get them wrong, especia=
lly in instances where you aren't the first person to listen to the recordi=
ng and someone else says, "Here listen to this. I think they're saying (fil=
l in the blank)". Our brains are going to tell us (fill in the blank) simpl=
y because that thought is now prevalent. If we're the only person listening=
 to the recordings, the same mistake can be made. The only conclusive way i=
s to use equipment that can amplify and break down the recordings to make t=
hem clear enough to be agreed upon by a number of people who don't know wha=
t conclusions the other listeners have drawn. 


The idea of a spirit disto=
rting the facts must also be considered. Not lying, per se, but rather gett=
ing the facts within their reality confused. This is where you have the rig=
ht to have the facts validated by the spirit. Ask them to prove it to you. =
They can tell you some corresponding items that back up their claims, direc=
t you to old newspaper stories or to a person they used to affiliate with o=
r bring the validation into your focus (meaning the same thing comes into y=
our life while you're driving/working/ at home/talking to someone/reading a=
nd etc.) at least three times. A spirit who is being truthful will not mind=
 trying to make this happen. 


Once these have been considered and elimina=
ted, then we should be willing to entertain the idea the spirit may be a lo=
wer energy being (a bully/swindler/ con-man or woman/narcissist and etc) in=
 their past life and this is the only way they know how to achieve what the=
y want. And yes, those spirits do exist. "As in life, so in death", meaning=
 our personalities don't change when our bodies die.


Al, maybe he wasn't =
trying to prove anything. Is it possible the spirit voice didn't mean he WA=
S (typed larger for emphasis) Steve Tate, but rather wanted to talk ABOUT S=
teve Tate or get a message TO Steve Tate? Did he mean to say "Still fate"? =
Could he have meant "paratrooper" ? See where I'm going with this? 


And f=
inally, in regards to the "end of the world stuff", it has been taught to m=
e by mediums and teachers who were all very honest and excellent at what th=
ey do, and it has been relayed to me by spirits I've encountered in my medi=
umship service that we don't have a free glimpse of the future once our bod=
ies die and we move into spirit form. I mean no offense and I'm not impying=
 that wasn't what was heard. That said (or rather 'typed'), I'd be VERY hes=
itant to believe this communication. There are beings that are privvy to th=
e potential (underscore "potential") future in our lives, but it isn't thei=
r nature to join us for EVP sessions. 


I hope I haven't taken liberty wit=
h this forum by posting such a long reply. I thank you for your time and at=
tention. If you have other questions or would like me to clarify something,=
 please ask. I'd be honored to share what I know and track down what I don'=
t. :) 


Michelle






    
     















    
     

    
    


 =

<div>
<p><br><br>Hello, all.<br><br>My name is Mic=
helle. I'm a certified medium with a Spiritualist church. This was a two ye=
ar process which involved proving I can communicate with spirits to a congr=
egation (not bragging - just trying to explain my background and why I know=
 what I do). I'm also one of the biggest skeptics you'll ever meet (It was =
one of two reasons I became a medium. I wanted to see how they were "faking=
" it. Surprise! They weren't). I'd like to contribute what I've learned abo=
ut spirits. As Jill wrote, "I(t) really takes personal experience to believ=
e this stuff exists".<br>
<br>As to her main question of "Why do spirits li=
e", I don't think we can always assume they're lying. If the information co=
mes through a medium, one of the first items to address is whether or not t=
he medium received the message correctly and then whether or not he/she int=
erepreted it correctly and phrased it in a way that allowed the recipient t=
o understand the spirit's meaning. There are a variety of ways spirits comm=
unicate with mediums; some are easier than others to understand and pass on=
. For the harder methods, it would be possible for a medium to inadvertentl=
y misinterept the message based on his/her past experiences. <br>
<br>When =
we look at the question from the connection to EVP's and ghost boxes, we ha=
ve to examine a few items. Was the spirit able to use the devices correctly=
 to form the words he/she actually intended? This is a two step process. It=
 can be difficult for them to not only pull the available energy into a use=
able form, but to also form the correct words (think it as a foreigner lear=
ning English and saying "car" when they mean "star". They sound similar, bu=
t have very different meanings). <br>
<br>Did we understand the words they =
said? It's fairly easy to get them wrong, especially in instances where you=
 aren't the first person to listen to the recording and someone else says, =
"Here listen to this. I think they're saying (fill in the blank)". Our brai=
ns are going to tell us (fill in the blank) simply because that thought is =
now prevalent. If we're the only person listening to the recordings, the sa=
me mistake can be made. The only conclusive way is to use equipment that ca=
n amplify and break down the recordings to make them clear enough to be agr=
eed upon by a number of people who don't know what conclusions the other li=
steners have drawn. <br>
<br>The idea of a spirit distorting the facts must=
 also be considered. Not lying, per se, but rather getting the facts within=
 their reality confused. This is where you have the right to have the facts=
 validated by the spirit. Ask them to prove it to you. They can tell you so=
me corresponding items that back up their claims, direct you to old newspap=
er stories or to a person they used to affiliate with or bring the validati=
on into your focus (meaning the same thing comes into your life while you'r=
e driving/working/ at home/talking to someone/reading and etc.) at least th=
ree times. A spirit who is being truthful will not mind trying to make this=
 happen. <br>
<br>Once these have been considered and eliminated, then we s=
hould be willing to entertain the idea the spirit may be a lower energy bei=
ng (a bully/swindler/ con-man or woman/narcissist and etc) in their past li=
fe and this is the only way they know how to achieve what they want. And ye=
s, those spirits do exist. "As in life, so in death", meaning our personali=
ties don't change when our bodies die.<br>
<br>Al, maybe he wasn't trying t=
o prove anything. Is it possible the spirit voice didn't mean he WAS (typed=
 larger for emphasis) Steve Tate, but rather wanted to talk ABOUT Steve Tat=
e or get a message TO Steve Tate? Did he mean to say "Still fate"? Could he=
 have meant "paratrooper" ? See where I'm going with this? <br>
<br>And fin=
ally, in regards to the "end of the world stuff", it has been taught to me =
by mediums and teachers who were all very honest and excellent at what they=
 do, and it has been relayed to me by spirits I've encountered in my medium=
ship service that we don't have a free glimpse of the future once our bodie=
s die and we move into spirit form. I mean no offense and I'm not impying t=
hat wasn't what was heard. That said (or rather 'typed'), I'd be VERY hesit=
ant to believe this communication. There are beings that are privvy to the =
potential (underscore "potential") future in our lives, but it isn't their =
nature to join us for EVP sessions. <br>
<br>I hope I haven't taken liberty=
 with this forum by posting such a long reply. I thank you for your time an=
d attention. If you have other questions or would like me to clarify someth=
ing, please ask. I'd be honored to share what I know and track down what I =
don't. :) <br>
<br>Michelle<br><br></p></div>
